messages.text: Explain reinforcement learning and show the relevent research paper.

Reinforcement learning is a type of machine learning where an agent learns to make decisions by taking actions in an environment to maximize some notion of cumulative reward. The agent receives feedback from the environment in the form of rewards or punishments and uses this feedback to learn the optimal actions to take in various states to maximize long-term rewards.

A relevant research paper on reinforcement learning is 'Teaching Machines to Read and Comprehend' by Karl Moritz Hermann et al. This paper explores the application of reinforcement learning to reading comprehension tasks. The authors propose a model called the 'Neural Semantic Parser' which uses reinforcement learning to answer questions about text passages and improves its performance over time by learning from its mistakes.
tell me about CNN and show me a relevant research paper

CNN (Convolutional Neural Networks) are a class of deep neural networks, most commonly applied to analyze visual imagery. They are inspired by the human visual system and are particularly effective for tasks such as image and video recognition, image classification, medical image analysis, and more. A relevant research paper discussing the use of CNNs is 'ABC-CNN: An Attention Based Convolutional Neural Network for Visual Question Answering' by Peng Gao et al. This paper presents a framework that combines CNN and RNN for visual question answering tasks and achieves state-of-the-art results.
